boost::constrained_value

boost::constrained_value Namespace Reference

The Boost Constrained Value library's namespace. More...


Classes

class  within_bounds
 Class template for value-within-bounds predicates. More...
struct  bounded
 An alias of constrained for bounded object types (using within_bounds constraint policy). More...
struct  bounded_int
 An alias of bounded with integral compile-time-fixed bounds. More...
struct  clip
 Error policy for constrained that clips the new value to the bounds. More...
struct  clipping
 An alias of bounded for bounded objects that clip the value to the bounds. More...
struct  clipping_int
 An alias of clipping with integral compile-time-fixed bounds. More...
struct  broken_constraint
 Class of exceptions used by error policies for constrained. More...
struct  throw_exception
 Error policy for constrained that throws an exception of ExceptionType. More...
class  constrained
 Template of constrained object classes. More...
struct  no_constraint
 A dummy constraint policy allowing for any value (and thus imposing no constraint). More...
class  unconstrained
 Alias for constrained with no_constraint used as the constraint policy. More...
struct  wrap
 Error policy for constrained that wraps the new value over the bounds. More...
struct  wrapping
 An alias of bounded for bounded objects that wrap the value over the bounds. More...
struct  wrapping_int
 An alias of wrapping with integral compile-time-fixed bounds. More...

Detailed Description

The Boost Constrained Value library's namespace.

Function Documentation

void swap ( within_bounds< L, U, LE, UE, C > &  lhs,
within_bounds< L, U, LE, UE, C > &  rhs 
)

Namespace-level swap for within_bounds.

Remarks:
All the within_bounds template actual parameters must be Swappable.

Definition at line 329 of file bounded.hpp.

void boost::constrained_value::change_bounds ( constrained< V, within_bounds< L, U, LE, UE, C >, E > &  b,
const TL &  l,
const TU &  u,
const TLE &  le,
const TUE &  ue 
)

Changes the bounds and the bounds exclusion for the given bounded object.

Calls change_constraint() with a new within_bounds object contaning the given values and the comparison object of the old within_bounds object.

Parameters:
b The bounded object to modify.
l The new lower bound object.
u The new upper bound object.
le The new lower bound exclusion indicating object.
ue The new upper bound exclusion indicating object.
Remarks:
  • V, L, U, LE, UE, C and E must be CopyConstructible and Swappable.
  • TL, TU, TLE and TUE must be Convertible to, respectively, L, U, LE and UE.

Definition at line 412 of file bounded.hpp.

void boost::constrained_value::change_bounds ( constrained< V, within_bounds< L, U, LE, UE, C >, E > &  b,
const TL &  l,
const TU &  u 
)

Changes the bounds of the given bounded object.

Calls change_bounds() with a combination of the specified and existing policies of the previous within_bounds object.

Parameters:
b The bounded object to modify.
l The new lower bound object.
u The new upper bound object.
Remarks:
  • V, L, U, LE, UE, C and E must be CopyConstructible and Swappable.
  • TL and TU must be Convertible to, respectively, L and U.

Definition at line 476 of file constrained.hpp.

void change_constraint ( constrained< V, C, E > &  c,
const T &  new_constraint 
)

Changes the constraint of the given constrained object.

Creates a new object with the value and error handler of c, but with new_constraint as its constraint, and swaps the object with c.

Note, that using this function is reasonable only when C objects have some internal state.

Remarks:
  • T must be Convertible to C.
  • V, C and E must be CopyConstructible and Swappable.

Definition at line 497 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained< V, C, E > & operator++ ( constrained< V, C, E > &  c  ) 

Pre-increment operator for constrained. Creates a copy of the underlying value of c, pre-increments it and assigns it back to c.

Returns:
c
Remarks:
V must be CopyConstructible, Assignable and PreIncrementable.

Returns:
c
Remarks:
V must be CopyConstructible, Assignable and PreDecrementable.

Definition at line 529 of file constrained.hpp.

const constrained< V, C, E > operator++ ( constrained< V, C, E > &  c,
int   
)

Post-increment operator for constrained. Creates a copy of c and then pre-increments c.

Returns:
The copy of c before the increment.
Remarks:
constrained<V, C, E> must be CopyConstructible and PreIncrementable.

Returns:
The copy of c before the decrement.

Definition at line 558 of file constrained.hpp.

constrained< V, C, E > & operator+= ( constrained< V, C, E > &  c,
const T &  v 
)

+= operator for constrained and T.

Creates a copy of the underlying value of c, applies the operator to the copy using the value of v and assigns the new value back to c.

Returns:
c
Remarks:
  • V must be CopyConstructible and Assignable.
  • += operator must be available for arguments of type V and T.

Definition at line 600 of file constrained.hpp.

std::basic_istream< Ch, Tr > & operator>> ( std::basic_istream< Ch, Tr > &  is,
constrained< V, C, E > &  c 
)

Stream extraction operator for constrained.

Creates a variable that is a copy of the value of c and calls stream extraction operator for the variable using is. If this succeeds, assigns the variable to c.

Note, that this operator reads only the underlying value from the stream, but not the constraint nor the error policy.

Returns:
is
Remarks:
  • V must be InputStreamable and CopyConstructible.
  • This function template is not defined if BOOST_NO_IOSFWD macro is defined.

Definition at line 628 of file constrained.hpp.

std::basic_ostream< Ch, Tr > & operator<< ( std::basic_ostream< Ch, Tr > &  os,
const constrained< V, C, E > &  c 
)

Stream insertion operator for constrained.

Outputs the value of c to os.

Note, that this operator writes only the underlying value to the stream, but not the constraint nor the error policy.

Returns:
os
Remarks:
  • V must be OutputStreamable.
  • This function template is not defined if BOOST_NO_IOSFWD macro is defined.
